details.header: The First Leap to Realize a New Breeze
details.headerDescription: A personal branding created to introduce a web developer with four main competencies
details.outline:
Background
This is a personal branding site that renews the personal portfolio site I made before. While planning a new design, I added animation effects and rewrote the code as I changed the page rendering method to the server side. In the UI planning phase, I designed it reflecting Apple's Human Interface Guideline. I wanted to provide intuitive and consistent experiences to users entering my page and to reflect it considering the store release of services created under my brand name in the future.
The reason for changing from Plain React to NextJS is solely for server-side rendering. I have plans to continuously expand this website. I changed the rendering method together as I judged that if complex animations and data bundles are continuously added to the single-page web that is made up of CSR, it will affect the user experience.
implements:
Common
Scroll/Mouse animation, motion slider, multilingual routing and translation, server-side rendering, responsive web screen, PWA
details.issues:
SEO and Performance Improvement
As it is a multilingual web, the standard site (canonical) and alternative site (alternate) were specified, but they were not detected in Lighthouse. It was confirmed as a problem due to duplicated layout code, and it was resolved by removing that part and specifying the link only in the multilingual folder. In addition, we improved the user experience by applying image compression and changing the format to Webp, and applying PWA.

details.headerDescription: A web service where technical communication challenges are reduced for professionals in service development, including planners, developers, and designers, enabling them to get to know each other better.
details.outline:
Background
Based on the discomfort felt from multiple team projects during school, this project was planned. Differences in technical understanding among developer team members, designers, and planners led to conflicts. We wanted to create a space for professionals to ask questions about different positions or the same roles within the team, share the latest trend information, and interact.
It uses a postcard-style communication method where text, pictures, and comments can be recorded. It includes various features such as profile creation, following, and a member ranking system. Profiles of all members are assigned different colors and ranks based on their positions, and their current roles in their work. This distinguishes the service from others.
implements:
Users
Regular/Social member registration, email verification, login, password change/reset, profile avatar and content creation, user rank, traces (follows), user reporting, user suspension

Posts
Create/delete/modify posts, multiple image upload, image slider, image compression, post liking functionality, comment creation/modification/deletion, post search, hashtag search, infinite scrolling post loading, recommended post loading
details.issues:
Data not loading multiple times while scrolling
An issue occurred where data loading requests were missing in event handlers with multiple branching due to the use of the existing scroll method. This was resolved by applying Intersection Observer and refactoring the code, removing multiple event request approaches to improve performance.
See Details

Deleting posts, comments, cancelling prods, and disconnecting traces revoke received points. Points are not given for commenting on one's own posts.

details.header: The Fastest Place to Meet People Like You
details.headerDescription: Real-time data transfer service using socket communication
details.outline:
Background
A service that allows real-time live messaging between 1:1 or multiple members using socket communication. BlooWays and Areas are concepts of larger and smaller conversation spaces respectively. Users can create multiple conversation spaces and invite desired members to communicate with those who share similar traits.
implements:
BlooWays & Areas(NSP)
Create BlooWays, create Areas, invite members, real-time message communication, indication of online users, post liking functionality, mention members, image transfer, indication of unread messages, infinite scrolling
details.issues:
Notification handling for unreceived messages
Situations were occurring where a user in Area A wasn't receiving notifications for messages sent in Area B. To resolve this, we stored the entry time and the last sent message time for each Area by the user. We then checked the number of messages with creation times greater than the sent time and sent this count to the client, which solved the issue.
View Details

details.header: A Glimpse into Vast Art Exhibitions
details.headerDescription: An interactive responsive web service that allows users to easily access exhibition information data on a single page.
details.outline:
Background
In order to access exhibition information from various countries, one would have to visit each country's page individually. This is a very inconvenient situation for those who want to explore information from multiple countries. To address this, we gathered exhibition information from various countries and compiled them in one place using web scraping techniques. We also added animations to provide visual appeal and incorporated filtering features so that users can view the information they are interested in.
We collected exhibition data using Python Selenium within the Robot Exclusion Protocol and designed it in card format on the page. The project focused on user interaction, animations, and frontend development. When a user requests a page, the controller loads shuffled MongoDB data and sends it as objects. Pug renders the data received from the controller onto the page.
implements:
Common
Scroll animations, card sorting animations, exhibition name/location/country search filtering, museum/art gallery filtering, card click animations, responsive web screen
details.issues:
Adjusting position when clicking on cards/opening and closing
When a card is clicked, it needs to gradually enlarge and center, and when closed, it should return to its original position. We had to implement the problem of calculating and subtracting the clicked card's coordinates (X, Y) relative to the user's browser viewport size to achieve this.
See more details

details.headerDescription: Introduction to a Cake Specialty Shop Set in a Greek Island Theme
details.outline:
Background
TIRA is a dessert brand specializing in Tiramisu, set against the backdrop of six villages in Santorini, Greece. It offers a variety of Tiramisu packages that reflect the characteristics, colors, and forms of the Santorini villages, ensuring that the design of the package and the taste of the product best match each village.
implements:
Common
Implemented a smooth-scrolling brand introduction page using GSAP that responds smoothly to scrolling. Implemented product introduction, shopping cart, and price adjustment features. Implemented user registration, profile creation, and editing features.
details.issues:
Implementation of Horizontal Scrolling and Screen Snapping
The intent is to provide a unique UX where the screen snaps smoothly horizontally instead of vertically as the user scrolls. Each section's elements were arranged horizontally, and the GSAP 'to' method was used to move the elements along the X-axis. ScrollTrigger's 'snap' and 'pin' properties were used to achieve smooth screen locking, resolving the issue.
